result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben Medina Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ruben Medina Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ruben Medina Jr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Ruben Medina Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, Counts 1 & 2 are consecutive to each other and to any other time serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
** Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. Perform 60 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Mcdonald's in question or Nicholas T., unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, Counts 1 & 2 are consecutive to each other and to any other time serving.

timeConds.notes:
Credit for 187 days.
Huber privileges are not allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Medina Jr

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

9:49 AM Defendant Ruben Medina Jr in court in custody.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Ruben Medina Jr.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HMcBride. State is compliant with victim rights notification.  On state's motion, cts 3 and 4 are dismissed.  DE enters guilty plea to cts 1 and 2.  Court finds DE guilty of cts 1 and 2.  Ct 1 - court imposes and stays 2 years incarceration, 1 year IC and 1 year ES with conditions;  DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions;  Ct 2 - court imposes and stays 2 years incarceration, 1 year IC and 1 year ES with conditions;  DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions; 10 months conditional time with credit for 187 days ; if revoked, cts 1 and 2 are consecutive to each other and to any other time serving; costs ordered; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Knapp.   Clerk HMcBride. Atty Knapp requests adjmt - problems with electronic discovery. STC 9/14 930am. Court also sets matter on for trial JSH 10/27 11am and JS 11/14 830am. Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Knapp.   Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Knapp recently apptd and needs time to obtian discovery. Offer received.  Adjmt granted.  FPT 7/21 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
